summary: The video discusses an experiment conducted by Jamie and Adam to determine whether running in the rain makes a person wetter than walking. The experiment aims to avoid mixing sweat with rainwater by using tight-fitting clothes and artificial rainfall. Wind is introduced as a variable to influence the results. Dyes are added to the water to make it easier to recognize. The experiment involves weighing work clothes before and after exposure to the artificial rain. Results show that running in the rain makes the clothes wetter compared to walking, both with and without wind. Viewers are asked to evaluate the rigor of the experiment and suggest improvements.
keywords: running, rain, experiment, Jamie, Adam, artificial rainfall, wind, dyes, work clothes, weight, wetter, walking
